def get_rest_api_id(self, api_name): """ Gets the ID of a REST API from its name by searching the list of REST APIs for the current account. Because names need not be unique, this returns only the first API with the specified name.
:param api_name: The name of the API to look up. :return: The ID of the specified API. """ try: rest_api = None paginator = self.apig_client.get_paginator('get_rest_apis') for page in paginator.paginate(): rest_api = next( (item for item in page['items'] if item['name'] == api_name), None) if rest_api is not None: break self.api_id = rest_api['id'] logger.info("Found ID %s for API %s.", rest_api['id'], api_name) except ClientError: logger.exception("Couldn't find ID for API %s.", api_name) raise else: return rest_api['id']
